instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H? PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H is the input voltage to the PP3V42_G3H buck converter circuit, it can be either charger voltage or battery voltage depending on what the system power source is. This often shorts to ground when one of the input capacitors dies. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H_REG: What is PP3V42_G3H_REG? PP3V42_G3H_REG is another way to say PP3V42_G3H. PP3V42_G3H_REG and PP3V42_G3H are a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message:
Hi, 
i have this board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no green led.
I check this voltage:
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>=16,53V
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H</SIGNAL>=16,13V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_REG</SIGNAL>=3,495V (each side of L6995)
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12,6V
<SIGNAL>P18V5_DCIN_CONN_R</SIGNAL>=16,41V
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>=3,35V
what can i check more?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message: i add more informations: no liquid, I use a power supply instead of magsafe board (16,5V display 0,02A)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message: Bad magsafe board? Does this board power on from a charged battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message:
No the magsafe board is good, and the board don't boot with battery charged and pad power on.
Do you have an idea duke?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message: Voltage on pins 1, 4 and 5 from <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> and on pin 5 from J6900??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message: I don't care about one-wire at the moment as it also does not power from a battery. SMC seems to be running as PPBUS is at 12.56V. What is voltage on <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message:
Hi
<CHIP>U6900</CHIP> 1,4,5 = 3,349V
J6900 5= 3,349V, sorry but the green led is here with another magsafe board, the led blink no really fix, but J6900 pin 5 on scope is good. but the board no boot, no fan, no display.
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL>=3,349V
thanks for your help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message:
So much for a good magsafe board...... :(

Check <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22/51/52. You sure this does not power from a known working battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message:
Ok i confirm, i test with another good battery not start when i short the pad start.
<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>=22ohm
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>=12,5
<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR>=12,5
<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>=3,1
<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR>=0,3

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message: <SIGNAL>G2_EN</SIGNAL> present? <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>=0v Pin2 <CHIP>U7941</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>=0V pin 6 <CHIP>U7941</CHIP> & <RESISTOR>R7951</RESISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message: Seems like the SMC to me.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message: Can i take it on a donate board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message: Take from identical donor.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message: ok can you confirm me it's <CHIP>U4900</CHIP>? how do you do to reball the chipset? sorry for this question but i haven't skill about that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message:
With a stencil, or by hand with a microscope and a bit of time.
There is SMC replacement videos on youtube for more information.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message: ok i see the video with louis, i find the stencil. thanks i post the result when i do the replacement.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message:
Ok i change the SMC and now i have <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>=3,35v Pin2 <CHIP>U7941</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>=0V always, don't boot again. :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message: Voltage on pin 6 from <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>?? Resistance to ground on L7220 without power applied of course...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message:
Have you checked for shorts on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> rail ?

If none are present whats voltage on pin 5 <TRANSISTOR>Q7221</TRANSISTOR> ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 6 = 3,469V
R to G L7220 = 5,33Kohm
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is not short (5,33Kohm)
<TRANSISTOR>Q7221</TRANSISTOR> pin 5 = 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message: Pin 5 on <TRANSISTOR>Q7221</TRANSISTOR> is low and that is correct. <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> should be enabled. Seems like <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> issue, check VREG3 and VREG5 and EN0. Replace chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message:
VREG 3 = 0V
VREG5 = 12,59V
EN0=3,45V
i need to replace the chip?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message: Check again, 12.59V is way to high, should be 5V...  If EN0 is high VREG3 should come high too, this seems to be a bad <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green led, no boot
threads.message:
Are you measuring the right pin? VREG5 should be 5v. You're getting 12.59v because you're measuring on <CAPACITOR>C7272</CAPACITOR> instead of <CAPACITOR>C7273</CAPACITOR> aren't you? 

Check voltage on pin <CAPACITOR>C7273</CAPACITOR>!
